senses.sense_definition: A public show of special respect or honor towards someone, often after their death or retirement.

examples.text: The soldiers stood in silence to pay <w>homage</w> to their fallen comrades.
This statue was built in <w>homage</w> to the city's founder.

senses.sense_definition: A work of art, film, or writing created to show respect and admiration for another artist or style.

examples.text: The director's new film is a loving <w>homage</w> to the classic westerns of the 1950s.
Her painting is a clear <w>homage</w> to the style of Van Gogh.

senses.sense_definition: A formal public declaration of loyalty and allegiance made by a vassal to a lord in the feudal system.

examples.text: The knight knelt to do <w>homage</w> to his king.
In the ceremony, the vassals swore <w>homage</w> and loyalty to the duke.

senses.sense_definition: To show deep respect or reverence to someone.

examples.text: The poet <w>homaged</w> the queen in his latest verse.
They <w>homaged</w> the ancient traditions through their dance.
